alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 1:52PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Laramie County through 215 PM MDT... At 152 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Natural Fort, or 17 miles southwest of Cheyenne, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Laramie County. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 349 and 355. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
